properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 10:48AM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...

.A significant winter storm is expected to impact the region late
Wednesday afternoon through Thursday, with widespread heavy
mountain snow accumulations likely. Snow levels are expected to
fall from 3500 to nearly 2000 feet early Thursday morning, which
will bring heavy snow accumulations to numerous interior mountain
highways, including Highways 299, 36, and 3, in addition to
numerous rural roadways. In addition, accumulating small hail will
be possible across coastal areas late Wednesday night into
Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected above 2500 feet. 2 to 6 inches inches of
snow expected with snow levels falling from 3500 feet this
afternoon to 2500 feet later tonight. Gusty south winds at the
onset of the snow will diminish quickly overnight.

* WHERE...Northern Mendocino County.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Thursday. Heaviest
snow will be overnight into Thursday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET
